textContent:
The byzantine themed region of Akytos. Once the crown jewel of civilization, it fell shortly after the Advent of Ether. This calamity, known in the lands as The Divine Forsaking, is a series of plagues, famines and otherworldly spirit invasions that completely ravaged and desecrated the land.

Interpreted by most as an act of abandonement by their God, some Akytasians have chosen to gain back God's favor, while some others completely abandoned their faith on a God that would allow such cruelty towards their people. The former are mostly bundled under the Order of Saints, while the latter are known simply as Forsaken. 
The Order of Saints has fled to a small island not far off the Akytasian shore, and live around a repurposed Monastery and its village. They promote their best members to Saints, which grants them special miraculous powers and a vertical halo behind their head.
The Forsaken, have sought solace in the wild and untamed regions surrounding what was once Akytos. They've formed nomadic clans, forging a new way of life amidst the harsh landscapes, determined to build a future independent of divine intervention. Among them there are druidic clans, pagans, cultists, chimeric people and outright atheists. In contrast, Azintium, with its soaring spires and heavenly vistas, remains a beacon of hope for the chosen few. The citizens are fiercely dedicated to their vision of a purified land, and they work tirelessly to realize this dream, believing it to be their divine duty.

There is, however, one final bastion of Akytasian culture: Azintium, the flying fortress. The city is suspended in the sky, and their citizens feel grateful to God and angry at the sins of their former brethren. They feel not guilty, and want to purify the lands below to repopulate it, now with the chosen people, true believers. They will, however, have to slay the plethora of spirits and chimeras roaming the lands, as well as deal with the apostates known as the Forsaken.

Many of the lucky survivors have fled to Bra'altir for better prospects, but they are generally not welcome. After the city hosted its first wave of refugees, it declined any further assistance to Akytasians.
